programme.title: The Unseen
programme.desc: The Unseen is about art, identity and solitude. It presents three interconnected vignettes that follow three different characters as they slip into spaces in Namibian society mostly unseen.

programme.desc: R.C. struggles in his job hunting due to the lack of one crucial skill while desperately attempting to pay off his debts.'

programme.title: The Man Who Mends Women
programme.desc: Doctor Mukwege is internationally known as the man who mends thousands of women who have been raped during the 20 years of conflicts in the East of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

programme.title: The Man Who Mends Women
programme.desc: Doctor Mukwege is internationally known as the man who mends thousands of women who have been raped during the 20 years of conflicts in the East of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

programme.title: JERMAINE
programme.desc: Jermaine Johnson is a 36-year old father of three and husband to his high-school sweetheart, Lawanna.

programme.title: Upper Hand
programme.desc: Upper Hand dives into the nuanced challenges Black and brown communities have faced in finding their pathway into the new economy by way of technology access, skill development, and opportunity. Data journalist and author, Sherrell Dorsey, follows the thread of her grandfather's story, growing up in the Jim Crow south, his migration to Seattle, and how he leveraged a job in technology to lay the foundation for his family's economic future.

programme.title: Pahokee - The Rabbit Hunt
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: PEACE OF QUEV
programme.desc: Peace of Quev is a portrait of Brooklyn artist Quindell Evans, whose music and poetry uplift his community and those around him.

programme.desc: Discovering ABJ is a coming of age story that reflects the diversity of a new generation of Nigerians seeking to express and define themselves in a changing world.

programme.title: BROTHERS HYPNOTIC
programme.desc: For the eight young men in the Hypnotic Brass Ensemble, 'brotherhood' is literal: they're all sons of anti-establishment jazz legend, Phil Cohran.

programme.title: KASITA
programme.desc: When little Luna canâ€™t keep the dog sheâ€™s rescued, she knows just what to do. Together with her cousin, Sol, she sets off to house the dog in one of the empty old huts that held enslaved Africans on Bonaire. Things donâ€™t go as planned

programme.title: T-Junction
programme.desc: After the passing of her estranged father, Fatima makes an unlikely friend at a hospital, Maria. Bound by pain, Fatima keepisodes coming back to hear Maria's tale of the T-junction where she found love and loss in a ragtag community

programme.title: ELEPHANT IN THE ROOM
programme.desc: A former, female boxing champion and her business partner coach are mentoring two teenage girls, best friends through their non-profit gym.

programme.title: BLACK MUSEUM
programme.desc: Through interviews and observation, Director Oliver Hardt, who frequently addresses black history and culture with a strong emphasis on architecture, takes us through the remarkable physical spaces, the palpable engagement of museum visitors, and gives us insight into the challenges faced during the design process. The success of the project serves as a reminder that design and advanced storytelling can challenge the dominant political discourse and enable a diverse conversation.

programme.title: A DIOS MOMO
programme.desc: Little Obdulio sells newspapers on the street to bring home a few coins for his family. His life is altered when he befriends the night watchman of the newspaper, a magical "Maestro," who will not only introduce him to reading, but also teach him the real meaning of life, using the lyrics of the "Murgas" under the spell of the God MoMo during the mythical nights of the Uruguayan Carnival.

programme.title: FLY BY LIGHT
programme.desc: An intimate exploration of young people seeking to overcome the violence in their lives and create a new path for their future by connecting to a world outside their neighborhood.

programme.title: AFRO PUNK GIRL
programme.desc: In a dystopian, post apocalyptic Britain, a self-professed young punk discovers true rebellion when she meets a radical old dandy.

programme.title: MANGO WARS
programme.desc: Mango Wars, a comedy set in present day Kingston, Jamaica, follows Mr. Brown who runs a mango jelly business with his pregnant wife, Mrs. Brown. Fed up with the theft of mangoes from his mango tree and the impending birth of his first child, he develops an elaborate plan to catch the thief red handed. But when all of the traps are set off by unlikely elements, Mr. Brown has to rethink what really matters.

programme.title: EMERGER
programme.desc: As the first woman to surf in her hometown of Dakar, Senegal, Khadjou Sambe emerged from a patriarchal system to become an icon for black women surfers all over the globe and pave the way for the next generation.

programme.title: BE A FISH
programme.desc: Determined, 9 year-old Taylor buys a fish in order to practice how to swim for her â€śBig Day.â€ť

programme.title: A LOVER'S CALL
programme.desc: Assim is torn between his faith and a growing bond with poet Kala when he realizes she isn't Muslim.
